Properties

CGFloat barWidth
 The width of each bar.
CGFloat barOffset
 The starting offset of the first bar in units of bar width.
CGFloat cornerRadius
 The corner radius for the end of the bars.
CPLineStyle * lineStyle
 The line style for the bar outline. If nil, the outline is not drawn.
CPFill * fill
 The fill style for the bars. If nil, the bars are not filled.
BOOL barsAreHorizontal
 If YES, the bars will have a horizontal orientation, otherwise they will be vertical.
NSDecimal baseValue
 The coordinate value of the fixed end of the bars.
CPPlotRange * plotRange
 Sets the plot range for the independent axis.
CGFloat barLabelOffset
 Sets the offset of the value label above the bar.
CPTextStyle * barLabelTextStyle
 Sets the textstyle of the value label above the bar.

Detailed Description

A two-dimensional bar plot.

Member Function Documentation

+ (CPBarPlot *) tubularBarPlotWithColor: (CPColor *)  color
horizontalBars: (BOOL)  horizontal 

Creates and returns a new CPBarPlot instance initialized with a bar fill consisting of a linear gradient between black and the given color.

Parameters:
color The beginning color.
horizontal If YES, the bars will have a horizontal orientation, otherwise they will be vertical.
Returns:
A new CPBarPlot instance initialized with a linear gradient bar fill.

Property Documentation

- (CGFloat) barLabelOffset [read, write, assign]

Sets the offset of the value label above the bar.

Deprecated:
This property has been replaced by the CPPlot::labelOffset property.

- (CPTextStyle *) barLabelTextStyle [read, write, copy]

Sets the textstyle of the value label above the bar.

Deprecated:
This property has been replaced by the CPPlot::labelTextStyle property.

- CPBarPlot: [read, write, copy]

Sets the plot range for the independent axis.

If a plot range is provided, the bars are spaced evenly throughout the plot range. If plotRange is nil, bar locations are provided by Cocoa bindings or the bar plot datasource. If locations are not provided by either bindings or the datasource, the first bar will be placed at zero (0) and subsequent bars will be at successive positive integer coordinates.
